name: Canada's Best Value Inn & Suites

reviews.text: We were pleasantly surprised at this Canadas Best Value Inn. We were impressed by the overall environment. The staff was friendly, and we loved the microwave and fridge in the room. A continental breakfast was included, and the hotel location was perfect for travelling into the city or out into the countryside. The breakfast area was quite crowded the day we were there with some groups occupying all the major utensils/equipment. The motel room was a little small and in need of some refurbishing/paint. Otherwise it was very adequate.
reviews.title: Great Location at a Fair Price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The place itself is dated and after reading other reviews we decided to get an upgraded, renovated room with jacuzzi. The room rate was to include a bottle of wine and chocolates.....they were never presented to us nor did they seem to know about it.....the continental breakfast was standard fare. Warning.....no elevators........their restaurant is downstairs and our updated room was upstairs.......no problem for us but there was a guest in a wheelchair who could not access the restaurant......I will give the hotel credit though,,,they had this guest order from the menu and had the food delivered to the dining area on the main floor used for continental breakfast . Our room was great, quiet and clean
reviews.title: Not bad but......

reviews.text: My oldest son and I were in your lovely city for a week for my younger son's football tournament-we had booked elsewhere but were less than impressed with the motel I had booked. I decided to look elsewhere, and found your motel for the same price and there were more amenities(pool,restaurant,microwave,fridge,phone!!) and to be perfectly honest, staff that could speak english. The rooms may be a bit small but they were clean and the grounds well maintained. There was a group of 'pre-war' cars there and the motel went out of their way to be sure there was room for thier cars,trailers/etc. Very accomodating and friendly, will reccommend to all!!
reviews.title: Very well maintained-front desk staff..great!

reviews.text: Very friendly staff, good location, easy to get in and out of the city. However the cleaness of this place is not satisfied. I had a white towel with yellow stains on it. Also becuase of its low price, this place is a very popular for big families, so if you don't mind waiting behind children for your breakfast in the morning.
reviews.title: It's OK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed three nights in early August. The layout is reminiscent of the 60s with the side-by-side units, but it's been nicely renovated. Very clean... Comfortable bed... A great breakfast, including waffles, but get there early to avoid the crowds and food shortages. One anomaly... No towel rods to allow you to hang and reuse your towel...
reviews.title: Good value...

reviews.text: The motel is situated on route 1 right next to University ave. and Charlottetown mall. The room we stayed in featured a large screen TV, a desk and a chair, a well equipped bathroom and a refrigerator. There's a large walk in closet which is very convenient.
reviews.title: A good place to stay in Charlottetown

reviews.text: The front desk staff are helpful and kind.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

reviews.text: Breakfast room is quite large and bright, and even though it's quite busy, the hotel staff do a good job keeping it clean and stacked.
reviews.title: Try your best to get an updated room, you won't regret it

reviews.text: Parking and Wi-Fi are free for the guests.
reviews.title: Great Value, Excellent Location, Very Clean Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I and grandson stayed here last year and are going back July 11 2011 everyone was so nice and we had a great chat with the owner. They were still in the Reno stage but we had a room already done. Breakfast was fine and we love loved the pool. Looking forward to going again in 3 weeks.
reviews.title: Perfect, better that expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When planning our Maritimes road trip, I had booked another Charlottetown hotel for 2 nights, but after reading the reviews of CBVI&Ss, I changed our reservations - and am glad we did! True - you are a bit out of the historic center of town, but if you have a vehicle it should not be an issue.
reviews.title: Excellent Lodging

reviews.text: The newly-remodeled room was clean and nicely furnished - with a large wall-mounted flat screen TV. The bathroom had new marble tile.
reviews.title: Stylish rooms at a unbeatable price.

reviews.text: The heated pool was clean & inviting. Wifi signal was very strong - even at the pool where we sat in the September sun. The continental breakfast selections wern't vast, but it was certainly adequite with ample seating. We were initially a little concerned as we were next to the housekeeping supply room, and feared it might be noisy early in the morning - but were were up & out for the day before that happened.
reviews.title: An Average Hotel, An Average Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, we could not have asked for anything better for a moderately priced motel.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were a late check in from Nova Scotia. We did not have a reservation as we were there for an unexpected funeral. Nellie from the front desk was wonderful. We stayed in a jacuzzi suite at a great price. I am in the hospitality industry myself and will be recomending this wonderful place to many people who head this way.
reviews.title: Make sure you're in the renovated half!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is exactly what it says it is. Comfortable clean rooms and close to the airport and major routes. Excellent free breakfast - continental kicked up a notch. Very accommodating staff eager to help.
reviews.title: Good Value
Pleasantly Surprised
reviews.text: We stayed at this "strip motel" this past Friday and Saturday, and we were very pleasantly surprised-we normally stay at the regular high rise type hotels. Other than a bit of dust, and wear and tear, in general, we were impressed by the overall environment. The staff was friendly, and we loved the little microwave and fridge in the room. A continental breakfast was included, and the location was great-15 minutes from downtown, and 5 minutes away from the Cow's factory and the outlet stores (Rockport, Paderno, Reebok, etc). We would come back in a heartbeat-great value for your money! (FYI: we travelled from Halifax, through PEI, Cape Breton Island, and back to Halifax-we were most impressed by this motel)

My mom and I chose deluxe room (rather small) with a Queen bed & a sofa. There were new drapes, bedspread & carpet, but an older bathroom. The beat up little old fridge, with no freezer door, froze our fruit!
reviews.title: Great value, clean, quiet

reviews.text: The rather standard breakfast was a bit of a hike from our room across the compound. The girl from the front desk tried to replenish the food as time allowed, and no one wiped the tables between guests. It was all help yourself.
reviews.title: Excellent spot

reviews.text: Staff was friendly & helpful & maintenance guys were working room by room to repair & update the facility. The pool was not open yet.
reviews.title: Good Stay

description: This beautiful property is newly-renovated (2010) to meet the needs of all travelers to Prince Edward Island. Standard rooms, standard suites, and jacuzzi suites are available. Continental breakfast and free wi-fi are included. On-site restaurant/pub is also available.
